title: 1 killed, 8 students injured in crash outside Little Havana charter high school
text:
1 killed, 8 students injured in crash outside Little Havana charter high school 
Crash in front of charter high school leaves one man dead, several students injured 
Miami police investigating deadly crash A Mazda van transporting high school students from Green Springs High School after lunch, collided with a Nissan Sentra at the intersection of Northwest Seventh Street and 35th Avenue, Wednesday, September 30, 2015. Walter Michot wmichot@miamiherald.com i 
An elderly nam was killed and eight students from a Little Havana charter high school were injured — two of them critically — when a van and car collided Wednesday afternoon. 
The crash happened just after noon in the intersection of Northwest Seventh Street and 35th Avenue. 
“It’s a major tragedy,” Miami Police Lt. Freddie Cruz said in front of Green Springs High School at 3555 NW Seventh St. 
Cruz said the students had just been released from school and were heading east on Seventh Street to a nearby Pollo Tropical for lunch. 
A black car was trying make a left on 35th Avenue when the vehicles collided, Cruz said. The van flipped and several other parked cars in the area were hit and damaged. 
The driver of the car was taken to Ryder Trauma Center, where he later died. Cruz said two students were critically injured, but most were taken to the hospital for observation. 
Miami police are looking into whether speed played a factor, Cruz said. 
Miami Herald photojournalist Walter Michot contributed to this report.
